title: OPL Junglers Round Table (LIVE Friday 6-7pm AEDT)
body:
Hey there aspiring Junglers and OPL Fans,

This week on the boards we are looking to test out a new format: The Round Table.

Rather than taking one team in isolation and asking them lots of bits and pieces, this is an opportunity for aspiring Junglers to ask the best OCE has to offer really specific questions.

**Start leaving your questions now**, so when the pros join us live on Friday - 6-7pm AEDT, there'll be plenty of content for them to dig in to and provide some key insights.

Joining us will be:

**Avant Garde:**  Lachlan _'Sybol'_ Civil - [@syb0l](https://twitter.com/Syb0l)
**The Chiefs:**  Samuel _'Spookz'_ Broadley - [@Chief_Spookz](https://twitter.com/Chief_Spookz) | [twitch.tv/spookz2](https://www.twitch.tv/spookz2) | [facebook.com/spookzlol](https://www.facebook.com/spookzLoL)
**Dire Wolves:**  Shern _'Shernfire'_ Tai - [@Shernfire](https://twitter.com/shernfire) |[ instagram.com/shernfire](https://www.instagram.com/shernfire/) | [twitch.tv/shernfire](https://www.twitch.tv/shernfire)
**Exile5: ** Eldin _'Guts'_ Skenderovic - [@GutsOCE](https://twitter.com/GutsOCE) | [twitch.tv/gutsoce](https://www.twitch.tv/gutsoce)
**Legacy: ** Tim _'Carbon'_ Wendel - [@OCECarbon](https://twitter.com/OCECarbon) 
**Sin Gaming:**  Brandon _'Juves'_ Defina -  [@sinjuves](https://twitter.com/SINJuves) | [twitch.tv/notjuves](https://www.twitch.tv/notjuves)

replies.body: In OCE what's the next step Junglers (or personally)  have to make in order for us to be as good as other regions? What separates you from Korea's top competitive junglers?

Based on my experience overseas, there's not one major aspect of the game that separates Oceanic junglers from the rest of the world but rather small things in each area that they're sharper and more consistent with, it takes only one mistake to throw a jungle lead and Korean junglers for example overall just make less mistakes.

How do you go about ~~fixing the amount of mistakes you make~~ reducing the number of mistakes you make? Do you reckon people are able to get away with more mistakes like Sybol said? Is reducing mistakes #1 priority?
the difference between OCE and Korea is competition OPL teams do not have competitive spirit other teams think this is high school friendship groups, this is competition.
Good question Alex!
Appreciate your comment Jay Rod

It's like being in an environment where you make a mistake but you didn't know it was a mistake because it doesn't get punished. Korea is constantly pushing the boundary on how to punish and you learn faster because if you don't adapt you will get crushed and lose
They don't believe in them selves...
Is rumble a viable jungler when he isn't using his rumble in the jungle skin?
we ask the real questions
It's pretty funny actually, Ceres is the reason Super Galaxy Rumble is disabled for literally every region right now lmao. (the bug happened in our game vs LGC last week)
i do not condone rumble jungle
No, if you don't own it I don't think you should be allowed to play Rumble jungle.

Juves here,

Super Galaxy recently got buffs in the jungle imo
What brought Elise back into the competitive scene? I randomly noticed that shes been getting picked/banned more than usual in regions like the LCK.
the jungle meta is spicy it just depends on what fits in a competitive draft

Elise has probably been the most staple jungle pick for the last couple of years, her kit in general is good for the jungle role competitively, she provides utillity, front line, she's mobile and arguably one of the best early ganking pressure. She typically falls in and out of the meta based on itemisation meta solo picks typically, she synergises really well with fighter top laners and assassin mids

Hey guys can someone find Daniel Ringland for me. I need to talk to him about my next business plan regarding the New-Zealand Highschool League. 
Cheers friends
aiiite

Hey guys,

What has been the most interesting jungle pick or build you've seen in competitive play?
Lira playing Cinderhulk, Triforce Nidalee was very unique.

Have you got any Kindred tips? I love playing the character, but I find them to be one of the more difficult jg champs to master. Anything you've learnt from playing the champ that might help other Kindred JG players?

Ahh, I think kindred is really hard to learn, especially now that she's so weak. I've put a bit of time into her and I can say in solo queue it's extremely important you get your marks. Make sure your team knows where they are (with spam pings) and hope that the enemy isn't paying attention.. Her early levels are pretty poor in 1v1s but her 2v1 and 3v2 are extremely strong if she doesn't get focused so try to avoid even fights until you have a few items (devourer/hurricane/BC).

Hi,

I would say try to think about what your enemies thinking when your playing Kindred. You can almost always assume that the enemy jungler will try to contest your marks, try to set up a pick or 1v1 if your stronger and snowball that way around your marks!

kindred is hard master because it's another jungle monster for the enemy jungler until you get blade hurricane. The champion is inferior in the first 3 levels so make sure your jungle path is avoiding the enemy jungler
If ADC's were to get old Graves back, which Champion would you each like to take from another role to replace him as a meta Jungler?
alistar jungle GREATEST JUNGLER
If you could replace one jungle camp with miniature versions of a Champion; which camp, and what Champion?
{{champion:64}}
a camp of like 6 little skarners would be way cooler{{champion:72}}

Juves here,

Shaco because noone likes Shaco. {{champion:35}}
i dont game design i just farm whats given to me :)
Shyvana, thoughts. yay? or nay?

Juves here,

Nay, to easily kited and needs to many items to be relevant.
YES IN DIAMOND AND BELOW, DEVOURER + BOTRK + CLEAVER

Im in low bronze and want some tips on how i can:
1: Clear faster without losing so much health early
2: how to counter jungle effectively without being seen and dying to enemy champions 
3: ward effectively
4: gank faster and better assist my lanes

Juves here,

Spookz hit the nail on the head.

But one thing I think is dont worry about "ganking faster", there is no such thing imo. Play to your strong lanes and your win condition if it takes you 10 minutes to pull off one gank then thats fine because the later in the game the more punishing the ganks can be. Worry about efficiency over frequency and speed!

Thanks Juves, 

you have a nice head

1. Runes and masteries are the easiest fix in terms of staying healthy in the jungle, switching to flat armor yellows for example can help. Secondly camp micro is typically underrated for the average player and is something worth studying and practicing, you should be able to find videos online or even consider watching some stream vods.

2. Pink wards are core for junglers on most bases and they help you clear out jungle entry vision. Outside of clearing vision you should look to take 'unconventional' paths into the enemy jungle to try catch the other team off guard, blast cones for example can help you catch the enemy team off guard.

3. Identifying when to defensively ward (typically your own jungle entrances) and offensive ward (on enemy camps) is super important for junglers. It is typically dictated by whether or not your lanes are winning  or losing (but not always obviously)

4. Ganking just comes down to game sense - you need to ask yourself what does my teammate offer me when I gank this lane? And how will the opponent react? Summoner spells and collapses should be considered as well.
I can play top, mid, adc and support fairly well, but i have always had trouble with jungle. Are there any small things I could do to improve my jungle play?

Don't overthink the role, just focus on the basics. Some things to thing about - which lanes are the best to support here, who should I look to snowball? How am I going to help this lane and what is the best jungle route will be the best to support that teammate. In most cases you can get away with focusing on assisting one teammate in the lane phase.

What needs to be changed in order for Amumu to become top tier again?

Also I'd be interested to see each of you power rank each other :^)

amumu will never be good unless his kit is changed 

we'll see who comes out on top in finals
Why is Wukong or Amumu never played in the jungle in competitive at all?  I'd LOVE to see them be picked in this last week by one of you fine gentlemen. {{champion:62}} {{champion:32}}

Juves here,

They arent picked because they have terrible early games and dont really scale that way either, easy to play against and play around. Just all round punishable champs.
amumu or wukong sucks ass cause amumu and wukong sucks ass

Hiya :)
I am an Eve one-trick and I have recently started getting coached. My coach tells me I "need to predict the enemy jungler, where they are, where they'll gank, what their path is, etc." but I have no idea how to even begin that. Any tips for prediction?
Thanks <3

I think the first step is identifying the most likely jungle paths for the enemy jungler (if you know for example the enemy jungler is starting blue he's likely going to be on the top side of the map at level 3) Once you start figuring out basic jungle paths you can slowly learn different variations and progress on your tracking.
Thanks :)

Juves here,

I agree with Shern, So if you can find out where the enemy jungler starts based off which lane leashes its very easy for you to learn the path of that jungler for the entirety of the early game, Example: Blue, wolves, Red = gank top? think about that and play around it.
